extendedInfo.description: A flashcard trainer which uses a Google Spreadsheet as a source for your learning data. Easly upload your vocabulary-lists to Google Docs (or create them with it) and than import your spreadsheets with this app to your phone as a flash-card trainer.Features: update from GDocs, Text-to-Speak, Powerlearning, Image trainers, Auto-Modus, and a lot moreOf course you can learn pretty much anything besides vocabularyAttention: You can NOT create your learning content with this application! Please use your Desktop-PC, go to http://docs.google.com and create your learning content. Afterwards download it with this app.Please check out the help-pages (click on the menu-button to get there). the help-page for the browser: http://elibera.com/android/flashcard/To deactivate the waiting time: Go to the settings-menu - "Levels - waiting time" and deactivate the waiting-time. Afterwards you have a session based learning experience.

reviews.title: Great
reviews.comment: Years ago i used to cut the cards myself. With this app it\'s easy to create them and i can practice anywhere. The different training methods are very effective.
reviews.author: Emese Marczis

reviews.title: Best app to learn english on android market!
reviews.comment: Currently this is the only developer who got the right idea what exactly tool a person studying english needs....
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Very usefull
reviews.comment: - it can be used as overal learning tool, not just only for vocabulary. I used it also for memorising mathematical formulas. - a little bug is that when power learning is finished, then it displays that one should wait for 30 minutes for a rest, even after 5 hours. A workaround is to delete trainer and then import it again.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Clean, clear, useful
reviews.comment: This is the exact example of a piece of software for which I would pay if I could. Reasonable sum of course and using secure payment method. Can you please consider, in the future, to include the possibility to add extra info for the front page? It would be useful for pronunciation or extra meaning specication of the word (in case of ambiguous meaning).
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Near-perfect
reviews.comment: I love this app so very very much. I just wish there was a way to make the font size for the menus bigger. I use my Samsung Galaxy Tab2 7.0 in profile most of the time, so the menu gets all squashed up at the top and it makes it difficult to click on the menu I want (I use this more as a personalised dictionary than a vocab trainer). But otherwise, excellent. Especially considering its free :3
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: very impressive
reviews.comment: Great app, using google docs to generate the content makes it so easy. The only negative is due to using picasa for pics is a bit clunky and a fair bit of work. Would be awesome if there was some way to use google spreadsheet to link to the pictures somehow. Other then that I couldnt be happier, makes learning new content easy and I can always practice when I have a few minutes spare. cheers!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Best ever tool for memorising
reviews.comment: I have used this app now for months. It is helping me to gradually conquer Icelandic, which is saying something. The power learning is a great concept \342\200\223 the forced repetition is invaluable for this kind of memorisation, and then going through the levels and being able to send a word back to level 1. It\342\200\231s obviously been well thought out. Plus being able to update via Drive makes it so convenient. I could see that this app could be used by anyone wanting to memorise anything \342\200\223 not just for languages.
reviews.author: Catherine Voysey

reviews.title: Can create own lists; great for text-to-speech
reviews.comment: This does what it says on the tin - I can easily create lists in Google Docs and import these. If you download Ivona text-to-speech and voices for the relevant languages, this app can then speak your chosen words in a very convincing manner. It\'s the only app I\'ve found where I can use my own lists of words and have them spoken from Android, until Quizlet come up with their own Android app.
reviews.author: Chris Boardman

reviews.title: Super-L\303\266sung, die ich sehr gerne nutze. Leider ein
reviews.comment: Eigentlich eine gute L\303\266sung, die ich sehr gerne nutze. Leider ein Stern Abzug wegen den h\303\244ufigen Abst\303\274rzen und ein weiterer Stern Abzug, weil das Problem schon viele Monate ungel\303\266st ist. Die Entwicklung dieser App scheint eingestellt zu sein. Schade!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Average
reviews.comment: Graphics are pretty awful, the pause rules are quite confusing and there\'s still the old flashcard-concept behind it, which makes it only average. But it\'s better than nothing, and besides Vocabulary Trainer for GDocs I have found nothing, so...
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: does not work for me
reviews.comment: this google docs thingy does not work on my motoroly defy (2.1). I read it features spaced repetition and wanted to get inspirations for my app FluxCards but since I installed it months ago I never could learn a word with it. Please fix. If I find an email address I will try to help fix that issue.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Fair
reviews.comment: Fairly good, but constantly stops in the middle and reboots. Please fix the glitch, or this is going to 1 star and uninstalling...
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Sehr gut!
reviews.comment: Bestes App! Ein sch\303\266neres Icon w\303\244re jedoch w\303\274nschenswert.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: great!!!
reviews.comment: I would love if I could keep the learning levels of each row even after updating, could be done using as id the row number
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Awesome app! Makes me a genius ;)
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Best app for language learning. Supports kanji! I\'d like multiple lines on front though. Author should make a donate version for a dollar or so.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: it is very convenient to be able to sync with google doc, but the repetition algo is so bad that the app becomes useless. too bad
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Brilliant,
reviews.comment: I used to write paper cards, but this is better in so many ways.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Easy to use
reviews.comment: I was looking for a good Android flashcard app that integrated with Google Spreadsheets since I switched from my iPhone (where I used to use gFlash+). This is it! Just pop all your data into two columns of a Google Spreadsheet and it\'ll import it as the front and back of your cards. Very nice.
reviews.author: A Google User
